Description:
Merchant-assigned reference ID for the request.
If included in the request, this value will be included in the response. This feature might be especially useful for multi-threaded applications.
This element contains a resultCode and one or more message elements.
States whether the request was handled successfully, or ended with an error.

The code number for the result.
For a comprehensive list of possible values, or to look up a returned value, see the Response Code Tool.
Format:
String, up to 6 characters.The first character is either an I for informational responses, or E for error responses. The remaining characters are numeric and indicate the type of informational or error response.
For example, I00001 or E00001.

Description: Text explanation of the code for the result.
An encrypted string that the merchant must include when posting to the Authorize.net web page. If not used within 15 minutes of the original API call, this token expires.
